This page covers profile details (viewing and editing your user profile) and changing your password.
The PMS shows notifications in the top bar via a bell icon. Use them to stay informed about housekeeping, reservations, and billing without leaving your current screen.
This page lists major updates to the Hotelium PMS user manual. The footer shows the current manual version (User Manual v1.0).

What you see and can do in the PMS depends on your user permissions. Permissions are assigned by your administrator through user groups or direct user rights. This page summarises which menu areas typically require which access.
Common issues and what to do when something goes wrong.

Adding screenshots to the manual makes it easier for users to follow. This page lists recommended screenshots and where to use them. Save images under static/img/docs/ and reference them in the docs as /img/docs/.png.
Quick reference for terms used in the Hotelium PMS manual.
Cashiering handles guest folio billing, payments, and cashier sessions. Access usually requires Cash Register Login before using Transaction, Cashier Shift, or Quick Checkout.

Welcome to the Hotelium Property Management System (PMS) user manual. This guide explains how to use the PMS application for daily hotel operations, from login and dashboard to reservations, front desk, cashiering, housekeeping, night audit, and system configuration.
The Transaction screen is used to manage one reservation's guest folio â€” charges, payments, adjustments, and printing. It is the main place to work on a folio in the cash register session.
Short guide to finding your way and using the Hotelium PMS manual.
Cashier Shift is used to open and close cash register shifts and view shift summary. Shift reports help reconcile daily cashier activity before night audit.
The In-House list shows all guests currently checked in. Use it to find a guest, open their reservation or folio, and perform check-out, room change, or add services.

The Checked-Out list shows guests who have already departed, usually for a selected date or range. Use it to review departed guests, reopen a folio if needed (within policy), and verify check-outs and billing.
The Dashboard is the home screen after login. It shows an overview of your property's status and quick links to common tasks.

Quick Checkout speeds up departure by selecting one or more reservations, applying standard charges to the folio if not already posted, taking final payment at the cash register, and marking them checked out.
The Front Desk area covers room plan, in-house guests, and checked-out guests. Use it for daily front-office tasks, room assignment, and quick access to folio and checkout.
The Room Plan shows rooms and their status over a chosen date range. Use it to see availability and quickly assign or change rooms.
The Maintenance tab is used to log maintenance requests or room maintenance records, associate them with room and type/reason (from configuration), and track status (open, in progress, done).
User Activity Logs record actions performed by users in the PMS (e.g. login, reservation change, payment, configuration change). Use them for auditing and troubleshooting.
Out of Order lists and manages rooms taken out of sale. Add a room and optional dates/reason; edit or end the record when the room is sellable again.
In Lost & Found you can register found items, link to a lost & found reason if configured, search by guest/room/date/item, and record when the item is returned or disposed of.

The Housekeeping module is used to track room status, assign tasks, manage lost & found, maintenance, and out-of-order rooms. In the app, the main screen is Housekeeping Management, with tabs for each area.
Night Audit is the end-of-day process that closes the business date, posts room revenue, and produces reports. It is typically run once per property per day.
The Tasks tab is used to create housekeeping tasks, assign them to attendants or sections, and mark them done or in progress.
The Room Status tab shows current status of all rooms. Use it to see which rooms are ready, need cleaning, or are out of order.
Company Profile stores data for companies used as guests, payers, or group organisers in reservations.
Profiles store guest and payer information used in reservations and billing. The PMS supports three profile types:
Individual Profile stores data for persons used as guests or contacts in reservations.
Travel Agent Profile stores data for travel agents and agencies used in reservations and commission or billing routing.

Night audit reports include daily summary, revenue summary, room revenue, exceptions, and guest ledger (charges and payments per folio) for the audit date. Often selected by audit run or business date.

Billing and revenue reports: revenue by transaction code or category, payments by type, outstanding balances, folio summary. Use after night audit or cashiering to verify totals. Filters often include date range and transaction or payment type.

Operations covers the day-to-day use of the PMS: reservations, front desk, cashiering (folio, cash register), housekeeping, night audit, and reports. Use this section to find the right screen and workflow for each task.
Front-desk and room-related reports: room occupancy, room status summary, room plan or availability.

The Report module provides predefined reports for reservations, front desk, billing (including folio summary), housekeeping, and night audit. Use it to run folio, cash register, and night audit reports from one place. In the app, Report is a menu with categories you can choose.
Reservation-related reports: arrivals/departures by date, in-house list, reservation pickup (by date, source, type), cancellations, revenue or occupancy by segment, source, or rate.
The reservation list (or â€œAll Reservationsâ€) shows all bookings. Use it to search, filter, create, edit, and manage reservations.
The Arrivals view (or filter) shows guests arriving on a selected date. Use it to see who is due to check in and prepare rooms and check-in.
Housekeeping reports: room status (vacant clean/dirty, occupied, etc.), task completion, lost & found log, maintenance log, out-of-order list.

The Cancellations view lists cancelled reservations. When you cancel a reservation, you often must choose a cancellation reason (from configuration). Cancellation may trigger policies (e.g. fees, release of inventory) depending on setup.
The Waitlist is used when no suitable room or rate is available. Store the request and convert it to a full reservation when space opens.

This page describes two common end-to-end workflows: check-in (from reservation to in-house) and end-of-day cashier and night audit. Use them as reference when training staff or writing local procedures.
The Reservation module is used to create, view, edit, and manage guest reservations. It is linked to profiles (individual, company, travel agent), rooms, rates, and billing.
The Departures view (or filter) shows guests departing on a selected date. Use it to see who is due to check out and prepare folios and checkout.
Follow these steps in order to see the main flow of the PMS: login â†’ dashboard â†’ one reservation â†’ one check-in â†’ one folio. Use this path when you are new to the system or training staff.
Guidelines for keeping the Hotelium PMS manual buildable, link-valid, and consistent.

Configuration is where you set up all reference data and options used across the PMS: rooms, rates, cashiering, profiles, housekeeping, and general settings. Access and visibility depend on user permissions. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules (reservations, front desk, cashiering, housekeeping, night audit, dashboard, profiles), see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections.

From the sidebar, go to Configuration. The PMS shows these top-level menus (names and order may match the application): Menu Sub-items (screens you can open) Reservation Setup Room Classes, Room Types, Rooms, Reservation Types, Reservation Methods, Booking Types, Business Segments, Floor Plans, Special Requests, Room Status, Room Move, Trace Codes, Origin Codes, Alert Codes, Discount Reasons, Cancellation Reasons, Waitlist Reasons, Lost Reasons, Refused Reasons, Inactive Reasons Profile Setup Preferences, VIP Levels, Loyalty Tiers, Titles, Languages, Nationalities, Regions, Countries, Territories, States, Districts, Cities, Postal Codes, Inactive Reason Rate Setup Rate Setup, Rate Classes, Rate Categories, Rates, Markets, Sources, Packages, Currencies, Exchange Rates Cashiering Setup Transaction Codes, Transaction Code Groups, Transaction Code Sub-Groups, Payment Types, Routing Codes, Cashiers, Articles, Exchange Rates, Service Charges Housekeeping Setup Out of Order/Service Reason, HK Sections, HK Attendants, HK Task, Room Maintenance Reason, Lost & Found Reason, Maintenance Type General Setup License, Hotel Information, Job Titles, Departments, User Groups, Users, Cash Register Setup, Transportation Type, System Date Setup, Track It What you see depends on user permissions. If a menu or sub-item is missing, your account may not have access.

Reference data for reservations and front desk: room types, room classes, rooms, reservation types, reservation methods, booking types, business segments, floor plans, special requests, room move reasons, trace/origin/alert codes, discount/cancel/waitlist/lost/refused reasons. See Reservation Setup.

Reference data for individual, company, and travel agent profiles: countries, states, territories, districts, regions, cities, postal codes, titles, languages, nationalities, VIP levels, preferences, loyalty tiers, inactive reason. See Profile Setup.
Rates and pricing: market groups, market codes, source groups, source codes, rate codes, rate classes, rate categories, packages, currency, exchange rates. See Rate Setup.
Billing and payments: transaction code groups/subgroups, transaction codes, service charges, articles, cashiers, routing codes, payment types. See Cashiering Setup.
Housekeeping setup: out-of-order/service reasons, HK sections, HK attendants, HK tasks, room maintenance reason, lost & found reason, maintenance type. See Housekeeping Setup.
Hotel info, system date, users, user groups, departments, job titles, license, cash register setup, transportation types, Track It (groups, locations, actions, types). See General Setup.

Set general and hotel data first (hotel info, system date, users). Define profile and reservation reference data (countries, room types, rooms, reservation types, sources, etc.). Configure rates and packages. Configure cashiering (transaction codes, payment types, cashiers, service charges). Configure housekeeping (sections, tasks, reasons). Order may vary; some items depend on others (e.g. rooms need room types, rates may need rate categories).

Why don't I see Configuration at all? Your user may not have any setup permission. Access is per area (e.g. rooms, rates, users). Ask your administrator to grant the permissions you need (e.g. view/edit reservation setup, rate management, users). Where do I add a new room type or room? Go to Configuration â†’ Reservation â†’ Room Class / Room Types / Rooms. Define room classes and room types first, then add rooms. See Reservation Setup. Where do I add a new transaction code or payment type? Go to Configuration â†’ Cashiering â†’ Transaction Codes or Payment Types. See Cashiering Setup. What order should I set up configuration in? Start with General Configuration (hotel info, system date, users). Then Profile and Reservation reference data (countries, room types, rooms, reservation types). Then Rate Management, Cashiering, and HouseKeeping & Maintenance. Some items depend on others (e.g. rooms need room types). Can I change the system date manually? Usually only before night audit has been run for that date, and only if your role allows it. Go to Configuration â†’ General Configuration â†’ System Date Setup. Night audit advances the date; avoid changing it without following your propertyâ€™s procedure.

Problem Cause Solution Configuration menu or category missing Your user lacks permission for that setup area. Ask your administrator to grant access to the relevant category (e.g. Reservation, Cashiering, General Configuration). Cannot save a new room / rate / code A required parent or field is missing (e.g. room type, rate category). Create the parent first (e.g. room type before rooms, rate category before rates). Check mandatory fields. Change does not appear in reservations or folios Some data is copied at reservation creation; or cache. New reservations use updated setup. Existing reservations may keep the value they had at creation. Refresh or reopen the screen if needed. User or cash register not in list User/cashier not created or not linked to the right property or register. In General Configurations, create or edit the user and assign permissions/cash register. Ensure the cash register exists in cash register setup. Lost & found reason or cancellation reason required but not in list Reason not yet created in setup. Add the reason in the relevant setup (e.g. Housekeeping â†’ Lost & found reasons, Reservation Setup â†’ Cancel reasons). For login, permissions, wrong property, and other general issues, see Troubleshooting.

This page covers profile details (viewing and editing your user profile) and changing your password.

Your user profile stores your display name, job title, contact details, and similar information. Access it from the profile or account area in the top bar (e.g. your name or avatar â†’ Profile / Profile details). From the profile details screen you can: View your username, email, job title, and other stored fields Edit allowed fields (depending on configuration) Go to Change password if the option is shown

You can change your password from Profile â†’ Change password (or the link in the profile/account menu). The change-password screen is also available at Change Password in the app when your administrator has exposed it.

Open Change password (from your profile/account menu or direct link). Enter your current password. Enter your new password. It must meet the following rules: At least 6 characters At least one uppercase letter At least one number At least one special character (e.g. ! @ # $ %) Enter the new password again in the confirmation field. Click Change password (or Submit). If the change succeeds, you are signed out and redirected to the login page. Log in again using your new password. Forgot current password? You cannot change your password without the current one. If you have forgotten it, contact your administrator or IT support to reset your password.
You must use the new password for all future logins. Other sessions may be invalidated; you may need to log in again on other devices or tabs.
The PMS shows notifications in the top bar via a bell icon. Use them to stay informed about housekeeping, reservations, and billing without leaving your current screen.
Look for the bell icon in the header or top bar (usually top-right). A badge or number on the bell shows how many unread notifications you have.

Notifications can include: Housekeeping â€” Lost & found, room status changes, maintenance, tasks, out-of-order Reservations â€” New or updated reservations, or other reservation-related alerts Billing â€” Payments, transactions, or billing alerts The exact types depend on how your property has configured the system.

Open the list â€” Click the bell to see recent notifications. Read one â€” Click a notification. It is marked as read and you are taken to the relevant screen when the system can determine it (e.g. a specific housekeeping tab, reservations, or billing). Unread count â€” The number on the bell updates as you read items. The list is refreshed automatically (e.g. every few seconds) so new notifications appear without reloading the page.

When you click a notification, the app tries to open the most relevant screen: If the notification is aboutâ€¦ You are typically taken toâ€¦ Lost & found Housekeeping â†’ Lost & found tab Room status Housekeeping â†’ Room status tab Maintenance Housekeeping â†’ Maintenance tab Housekeeping tasks Housekeeping â†’ Tasks tab Out of order Housekeeping â†’ Out of order tab Housekeeping (general) Housekeeping management Reservations Reservation list Billing / payment / transaction Billing / Cashiering If the message does not match any of these, the notification may only be marked as read and no navigation occurs.
Check the bell regularly so you donâ€™t miss housekeeping or billing alerts. Clearing the list does not delete the underlying data; it only marks items as read in your notification list.

This page lists major updates to the Hotelium PMS user manual. The footer shows the current manual version (User Manual v1.0). When we publish updates, we add a new row below with the version, date, and a short summary of what changed. Use it to see whatâ€™s new or to match the manual to your product version.

Version Date Changes v1.0 January 2025 Initial release. Introduction, dashboard, operations (workflows, reservations, front desk, cashiering, housekeeping, night audit, reports, profiles), configuration, troubleshooting, glossary, and general topics. New to the manual? Start with the Introduction and use By role to jump to the docs for your job.

What you see and can do in the PMS depends on your user permissions. Permissions are assigned by your administrator through user groups or direct user rights. This page summarises which menu areas typically require which access.

If you do not see a menu item, your user probably does not have the permission needed for that part of the system. Menu or section What you need (typical) Dashboard No special permission; usually visible to all logged-in users. Profile (Individual / Company / Travel Agent) Permission to view at least one profile type (individual, company, or travel agent). Reservation Permission to view, add, or edit reservations. Front Desk (Room plan, In-house, Checked-out) Permission to view reservations and/or to check in / check out, and often account-receivable access. Cashiering (Transaction, Cashier shift, Quick checkout) Cashier permission. You also must log in to a cash register before using cashier screens. Housekeeping Permission to view room status, out-of-order, maintenance, tasks, and/or lost & found. Night Audit Night audit permission. Report Permission to view reports. Operations â†’ General â†’ User Activity Logs Permission to view user activity logs. System Settings At least one permission in setup (e.g. rooms, rates, reservation setup, profiles, cashiering, housekeeping, account receivables). The full System Settings menu shows all config areas your account can access.

Permissions are usually grouped by area: Profile management â€” Individual, company, travel agent (view / add / edit / delete). Reservation management â€” Reservations (view / add / edit / delete), check-in, check-out, cancel, waitlist. Front desk / AR â€” Account receivable, in-house, checked-out, room plan. Cashier â€” View cashier, use transaction / shift / quick checkout. Housekeeping â€” Room status, out-of-order, maintenance, tasks, lost & found, sections, attendants, etc. Night audit â€” Run night audit, view runs and reports. Reports â€” View (and sometimes generate or export) reports. User activity log â€” View (and sometimes export) activity logs. Setup / configuration â€” Each setup area (e.g. rooms, rates, transaction codes, users) has its own view / add / edit / delete permissions. Your administrator assigns these through user groups or per-user settings in System Settings â†’ Users / User groups.

Missing menu or button â€” Ask your administrator to grant the right permissions or add you to a user group that has them. â€œAccess deniedâ€ or similar â€” You tried an action your account is not allowed to do; request the specific permission (e.g. â€œedit reservationsâ€, â€œrun night auditâ€) from your admin. Exact permission names and behaviour can vary by deployment; your administrator has the definitive list for your property.
documents.s: What to Do If You Need Access

documents.t: Common issues and what to do when something goes wrong. Module-specific help Many modules have their own Common FAQs and Troubleshooting sections: Reservations, Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, Night Audit, Dashboard, Configuration, Profiles. Check those pages first for issues in that area.

Problem What to try â€œLogin failedâ€ or invalid credentials Check username and password (username â‰¥ 3 chars, password â‰¥ 6). Ask your admin to confirm your account is active. Redirected to login after logging in Clear browser cache/cookies or try another browser. Ensure cookies are allowed for the PMS URL. Forgot password Contact your administrator; password reset is typically done via admin or IT.

Problem What to try Cannot open Cashiering Log in to a cash register first (Cash Register Login). Ensure your user is linked to a cashier and cash register. Charge or payment fails Check transaction code and payment type are active. Ensure reservation is in a status that allows posting (e.g. checked in). Cannot void Void rules may require a reason or approval; check configuration. Some items may be locked after night audit.

Problem What to try Room type not available Check dates and room status (e.g. out of order). Confirm rate/availability setup for that room type and date. Cannot check in Reservation must be in a status that allows check-in (e.g. confirmed). Room may need to be clean/ready in housekeeping. Cannot change room Verify room move reasons and permissions. Target room must be available and in a sellable status.

Problem What to try Room status not updating Refresh the page. Confirm you have permission to change that roomâ€™s status. Lost & found / maintenance not saving Ensure required fields (e.g. reason, location) are filled. Check that related setup (reasons, locations) exists.

Problem What to try Night audit fails or shows exceptions Resolve listed exceptions (e.g. open balances, invalid data). Ensure room charges are posted and cashier shifts are closed if required. System date did not advance Night audit may have been run in â€œreport onlyâ€ or dry-run mode, or an error stopped the run. Check audit run status and logs.

Problem What to try Report empty or wrong dates Set the correct date range and filters. For night-audit reports, pick the correct audit run or business date. Report access denied Your user may not have permission for that report category. Ask your admin to adjust permissions.

Problem What to try Menu item missing Your permissions may not include that module. Contact your administrator. Slow or timeout Check network and backend status. For heavy reports, narrow date range or filters. Wrong hotel / property Use the hotel switcher (if multi-property) to select the correct property. Still stuck? Contact your PMS administrator or IT support with: what you were doing, which screen, and the exact message or behaviour you see.

Adding screenshots to the manual makes it easier for users to follow. This page lists recommended screenshots and where to use them. Save images under static/img/docs/ and reference them in the docs as /img/docs/<filename>.png.

When adding or updating procedures, prioritize these screenshots so the manual stays usable: Priority Screenshot Doc(s) Filename Must Login screen Intro login.png Must Dashboard Dashboard dashboard.png Must Reservation list or new-reservation form Reservations reservation-list.png or reservation-form.png Must Transaction / folio Cashiering folio.png Must Night audit (runs or run dialog) Night Audit night-audit.png See Technical and maintenance for the full checklist (including â€œnice to haveâ€ items).

# Description Suggested filename Use in doc(s) 1 Login screen â€” Username and password fields, Login button login.png Introduction 2 Dashboard â€” Overview stats, widgets, quick actions dashboard.png Dashboard 3 Main sidebar â€” Full menu (Dashboard, Profile, Reservation, Front desk, etc.) sidebar.png Introduction 4 Reservation list â€” Table with confirmation, guest, room, dates, status reservation-list.png Reservations 5 New reservation form â€” Guest, dates, room type, rate, main fields reservation-form.png Reservations 6 Room plan â€” Rooms by floor/type with status and guest names room-plan.png Front Desk 7 Transaction / folio â€” Charges, payments, balance for one reservation folio.png Cashiering 8 Housekeeping management â€” Tabs (Room status, Tasks, Lost & found, etc.) housekeeping.png Housekeeping 9 Night audit â€” Audit runs list or Run night audit dialog night-audit.png Night Audit 10 Notifications bell â€” Bell icon with unread count in header notifications-bell.png Notifications 11 Change password â€” Current password, new password, confirm fields change-password.png Profile and Security 12 System Settings â€” Configuration menu or main config landing configuration.png Configuration overview

Save the image under pmsusermanual/static/img/docs/ (create the folder if needed). In the markdown file, add: ![Short description of what the image shows](/img/docs/filename.png) Optionally add a caption: ![Login screen](/img/docs/login.png) *Figure: Login screen with username and password fields.*
documents.s: How to Add a Screenshot in a Doc

documents.t: Use PNG for clarity; JPEG is fine for photos if file size is an issue. Crop to the relevant area (e.g. one form or one list) so the image stays clear. Blur or redact real guest names, confirmation numbers, or amounts if needed for privacy. Keep filenames short and lowercase (e.g. login.png, room-plan.png).

Some docs include a short â€œSuggested screenshotâ€ note where an image would help. Replace that text with the actual image markdown once the screenshot is added. If you prefer not to use images yet, you can leave the note as-is so future editors know where to add one.

Quick reference for terms used in the Hotelium PMS manual. Term Meaning ADR Average Daily Rate â€” Total room revenue divided by number of rooms sold (or occupied) for a given period. Audit run One execution of night audit for a given business date. Business date The â€œtodayâ€ date used for reservations, rates, and reporting (same as system date when that is used). Cash register A logical register used for cashier login; each cashier session is tied to a register. Check-in Marking a reservation as in-house; guest is occupying the room. Check-out Marking a reservation as departed; stay is complete. Configuration System settings and reference data (rooms, rates, codes, etc.); same as System Settings. Folio Guest bill for a stay; list of charges and payments. A reservation can have one or more folios. In-house Guest is currently staying (checked in, not yet checked out). Market A category or segment used in rate setup to group business (e.g. corporate, leisure, FIT). Used for pricing and reporting. Night audit End-of-day process that posts room revenue, advances the business date, and produces reports. No-show A reservation where the guest did not arrive and did not cancel; the stay is treated as lost or no-show per property policy. Occupancy Percentage of rooms sold or occupied (occupied rooms Ã· total rooms Ã— 100) for a given date or period. Package A rate that bundles room nights with other services (e.g. breakfast, spa, parking); defined in rate setup. Post (charge) Add a charge to a folio (e.g. room, minibar, tax). Profile Guest or payer record: individual (person), company, or travel agent. Reservation A booking for a stay: guest, dates, room, rate, status. RevPAR Revenue Per Available Room â€” Total room revenue divided by total rooms available for a given period (ADR Ã— occupancy). Room plan View of rooms and their status/occupancy by date. Routing Sending part or all of a bill to another profile (e.g. company, travel agent). Source Where a reservation comes from (e.g. direct, OTA, travel agent, walk-in); used in rate setup and reporting. System date Same as business date when the property uses a separate â€œhotel dateâ€ for operations. Transaction code Code that defines a type of charge or adjustment (e.g. room, tax, F&B). Void Cancel a charge or payment so it no longer counts in the balance. Waitlist List of requests when no suitable room or rate is available; can be converted to a reservation later. Walk-in A guest who arrives without a reservation and is given a room on the spot; often recorded as a source or booking type.

Cashiering handles guest folio billing, payments, and cashier sessions. Access usually requires Cash Register Login before using Transaction, Cashier Shift, or Quick Checkout. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections. In the app, Cashiering is a menu with three sub-screens: Screen Purpose Transaction Work on a specific reservation's folio (charges, payments, adjustments). Cashier Shift Open/close cashier shifts and view shift summary. Quick Checkout Speed up checkout for selected reservations.

Before using cashier functions: Go to Cashiering in the sidebar (or a sub-item such as Transaction). If prompted, you are taken to Cash Register Login. Select (or enter) your cash register and complete the login. After that, you can use Transaction, Cashier Shift, and Quick Checkout as permitted.

Why can't I open Cashiering or the Transaction screen? You must log in to a cash register first. Go to Cashiering, use Cash Register Login, select your register, and complete login. Your user must be linked to a cashier and cash register in configuration. What is the difference between Transaction and Quick Checkout? Transaction is for working on one reservation's folio (charges, payments, adjustments). Quick Checkout speeds up departure by selecting one or more reservations, applying standard charges if needed, taking payment, and marking them checked out in fewer steps. Where do I see my cashier shift summary? Go to Cashiering â†’ Cashier Shift. You can open a shift (declare starting float) and close it (declare expected vs actual). Shift reports help reconcile daily activity. For more FAQs and troubleshooting, see Transaction or the troubleshooting table below. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Problem Cause Solution Cannot open Cashiering / Transaction Not logged in to a cash register, or user not linked to a cashier/register. Log in at Cash Register Login. Ask your administrator to link your user to a cashier and cash register in Configuration â†’ Cashiering. Charge or payment fails to post Transaction code or payment type inactive; reservation not in a status that allows posting. Ensure the transaction code and payment type are active. For charges/payments, the reservation usually must be checked in. Cannot void Void rules require a reason or approval; or item is locked after night audit. Enter the required void reason or request approval per configuration. If locked, follow your property's policy for corrections. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Night Audit â€” Post room charges, close business date, view audit reports and guest ledger. Close cashier shifts before running night audit. Reports â€” Billing and Night Audit reports for folio summary, revenue, and guest ledger. Reservations â€” Guest and stay data; open folio from reservation or Front Desk. Front Desk â€” In-house and checked-out lists; quick access to folio and checkout. Configuration overview â€” Transaction codes, payment types, cashiers and cash register under Configuration â†’ Cashiering.

Welcome to the Hotelium Property Management System (PMS) user manual. This guide explains how to use the PMS application for daily hotel operations, from login and dashboard to reservations, front desk, cashiering, housekeeping, night audit, and system configuration. New to this manual? Using this manual explains search, keyboard shortcuts, print/PDF, and how to find your way. Having a problem? See the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting for Reservations, Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, Night Audit, Dashboard, Configuration, and Profiles.

Hotelium PMS is a web-based property management system that supports: Dashboard â€” Overview of occupancy, revenue, housekeeping status, and quick actions Reservations â€” Create, edit, and manage reservations; List, Arrivals, Departures, Waitlist, Cancellations Profiles â€” Individual, company, and travel agent profiles (under Operations) Front Desk â€” Room plan, in-house guests, checked-out guests Cashiering â€” Transactions, cashier shifts, quick checkout Housekeeping â€” Room status, tasks, lost & found, maintenance, out-of-order Night Audit â€” Run night audit, view summaries, post room charges, exceptions Reports â€” Reservation, frontdesk, billing, housekeeping, night audit reports System Settings â€” Configuration for rooms, rates, cashiering, profiles, and more
First day? Do these steps in order. Quick start walks through: login â†’ dashboard â†’ one reservation â†’ one check-in â†’ one folio. Follow it step by step, then use the links below for detail.

Open the PMS application in your browser. Enter your username (at least 3 characters). Enter your password (at least 6 characters). Click Login. If credentials are valid, you are redirected to the Dashboard. If you are not logged in and open the app, you are redirected to the login page. After login, you are sent to the Dashboard. Suggested screenshot Add a screenshot of the login screen (username, password, Login button) here. Save as static/img/docs/login.png. See Screenshot guide. Forgot password? Contact your administrator to reset your password. Password reset may be available via your organisationâ€™s IT or PMS admin.

The main sidebar shows: Dashboard â€” Home and overview Profile â€” Individual Profile, Company Profile, Travel Agent Profile Reservation â€” Reservations (includes waitlist and cancellation views) Front Desk â€” Room Plan, In-House, Checked-Out Cashiering â€” Transaction, Cashier Shift, Quick Checkout Housekeeping â€” Housekeeping management Night Audit â€” Night audit runs and summaries Report â€” Reservation, Frontdesk, Billing, Housekeeping, Night Audit Operations â†’ General â€” User Activity Logs (if permitted) System Settings â€” All configuration screens Visibility of menus depends on your user permissions. If you do not see a section, your account may not have access. Print or save as PDF Use your browserâ€™s Print (Ctrl+P / Cmd+P) to print a page or Save as PDF. The Transaction screen is used to manage one reservation's guest folio â€” charges, payments, adjustments, and printing. It is the main place to work on a folio in the cash register session.
From the sidebar: Cashiering â†’ Transaction. You must complete Cash Register Login first if prompted.
Search by guest name, confirmation number, or room. Select the reservation to open its folio.

The folio shows: Charges â€” Room, tax, and other items (from transaction codes) Payments â€” Payments by type (cash, card, etc.) Balance â€” Total charges minus payments Charges and payments are grouped by folio number if your property uses multiple folios per reservation.
Use Add Charge (or similar). Choose Transaction Code (e.g. room, minibar, laundry). Enter amount, quantity, description if needed. Save. The charge appears on the folio.
Use Payment (or Add Payment). Choose Payment Type (cash, card, etc.). Enter amount and any reference (e.g. last 4 digits of card). Save. The payment reduces the balance.

Post Room Charge posts room revenue for a stay (often used in night audit or from cashier). It creates or updates room charges based on the rate and dates. This may be available from the Transaction screen or from Night Audit, depending on configuration.
Edit â€” Change amount or details of a charge or payment when allowed. Void â€” Void a charge or payment. Void rules (e.g. reason, approval) are set in configuration.
If routing or split folio is available, you can route part of the bill to another profile (e.g. company, travel agent) or split charges across folios or payers.
Print Folio â€” Guest folio for handover or records. Proforma Invoice â€” Draft invoice before finalising.

Night Audit â€” Post room charge from here or from Night Audit; run night audit after reconciling folios. Reports â€” Billing and Night Audit reports for folio summary and guest ledger. Cashier Shift â€” Open/close shifts and reconcile. Quick Checkout â€” Speed up departure. Configuration overview â€” Transaction codes, payment types under Configuration â†’ Cashiering.
Short guide to finding your way and using the Hotelium PMS manual.

Use the search bar in the top-right of the navbar (or Ctrl+K / Cmd+K) to search all docs. Type terms like â€œfolioâ€, â€œnight auditâ€, â€œcash registerâ€, â€œreservationâ€, or â€œcheck-inâ€ to jump to the right page.

Breadcrumbs (above the doc) show where you are, e.g. Docs > Operations > Reservations. The sidebar lists all sections. Collapse or expand categories as needed. On some setups you can hide the sidebar for more reading space.
When the manual is built from a git repository, each doc page shows â€œLast updatedâ€ at the bottom with the date of the last edit. Use it as a rough guide to how recent the content is.
On long pages, a Back to top button (â†‘) appears when you scroll down. Click it to scroll to the top of the page.

Print â€” Use your browserâ€™s Print (Ctrl+P / Cmd+P). The manual uses print styles so the main content prints without the navbar and sidebar. Save as PDF â€” In the Print dialog, choose Save as PDF (or similar) as the destination.

Action Shortcut Search (open search) Ctrl+K (Windows/Linux) Â· Cmd+K (Mac) Print Ctrl+P (Windows/Linux) Â· Cmd+P (Mac) Back to top Click the â†‘ button when it appears after scrolling (no keyboard shortcut)

The manual is readable on phones and tablets â€” the layout adapts to small screens so you can look up topics on the go. We follow common web accessibility practices (semantic structure, keyboard navigation, contrast) and continue to improve where we can.

The In-House list shows all guests currently checked in. Use it to find a guest, open their reservation or folio, and perform check-out, room change, or add services.

Problem Cause Solution In-House list is empty but I have guests Filter (date, property) or permission may be hiding results. Check date range and property filter. Confirm your user has permission to view in-house reservations. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.
