Problem Cause Solution Cannot reopen a checked-out folio Policy or permission may restrict reopening after checkout. Follow your property's policy; if allowed, use the reopen or edit action from Checked-Out. Contact your administrator if the option is missing. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.
In-House â€” Guests move to Checked-Out after check-out. Room Plan â€” Check out from room plan or reservation. Cashiering â€” Folio and payments before and after checkout.

The Dashboard is the home screen after login. It shows an overview of your property's status and quick links to common tasks. Suggested screenshot Add a screenshot of the dashboard (overview stats, widgets, quick actions) here. Save as static/img/docs/dashboard.png. See Screenshot guide. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules (reservations, front desk, cashiering, housekeeping, night audit, configuration, profiles), see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections.

The dashboard displays: Room overview â€” Total rooms, current occupancy, occupancy rate, available rooms, room types, room classes Today's stats â€” Check-ins, check-outs, active staff, revenue Period stats â€” Recent reservations, monthly reservations, total/active guests, monthly revenue Room status â€” Total, available, occupied, maintenance, out of order Housekeeping â€” Vacant clean/dirty, occupied clean/dirty, pick-up, inspected, out of order, out of service
Shows how many rooms are available by type or class. Use this to see what you can sell or assign.
Summarizes housekeeping statuses (e.g. vacant clean, vacant dirty, occupied clean, occupied dirty, pick-up, inspected, out of order, out of service). Helps coordinate room readiness.
Revenue over a selected period, used for a quick view of performance.
Charts for VIP distribution and complimentary stays, if configured.
A list of recent reservations with guest name, room type, arrival/departure, status, nights. Use it to see the latest activity.
If your property uses a system date (business date) different from the actual date, it is shown on the dashboard. Night audit advances this date.

Common actions are available as buttons or links: View reservations â€” Go to the reservation list New reservation â€” Open the new reservation form Room plan â€” Open the front desk room plan Housekeeping â€” Open housekeeping management Use these to move quickly from the dashboard into the right module.

From the dashboard you can go to: Reservation â€” List and new reservation Front Desk â†’ Room Plan â€” Room plan view Housekeeping â€” Housekeeping management Exact labels and actions depend on product version and permissions.

Why don't I see the Dashboard after login? The Dashboard is the default home after login. If you are sent somewhere else, your role or configuration may define a different landing page. Use the Dashboard item in the sidebar to open it. What is the system date on the dashboard? If your property uses a system (business) date different from the real date, it is shown on the dashboard. Night audit advances this date. New reservations, rates, and reports use the business date as "today." How do I go to a new reservation from the dashboard? Use the New reservation quick action (or equivalent). It opens the new-reservation form. You can also go to Reservation in the sidebar and click New Reservation. Why do my dashboard numbers not match other screens? Dashboard stats are often cached or calculated at a specific time. Room plan and reports use live or filtered data. Check date filters and system date; refresh the dashboard if your product supports it. Where do I see today's check-ins and check-outs? The dashboard shows Today's stats (check-ins, check-outs). For the full list, use Reservation (filter by arrival/departure date) or Front Desk â†’ In-House and Checked-Out.

Problem Cause Solution Dashboard shows wrong property The active property (hotel) is not the one you expect. Use the hotel switcher (if multi-property) to select the correct property. Widget or stat missing Your permissions or configuration may hide that widget. Confirm your role can see that stat. Some widgets depend on System Settings (e.g. VIP, revenue). Quick action does nothing or is missing Permission or product version may not include that action. Check Roles and permissions. Use the sidebar to go to the module (e.g. Reservation, Housekeeping) if the quick action is hidden. System date is behind or ahead Night audit may not have been run, or was run for a different date. Night audit advances the business date. Ensure it is run once per day; check with your night auditor or administrator. For login, permissions, wrong property, and other general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Reservations â€” List and new reservation; quick actions from dashboard. Front Desk â€” Room plan quick action. Housekeeping â€” Housekeeping quick action; dashboard housekeeping summary. Reports â€” For detailed reports, use Report in the sidebar.

Quick Checkout speeds up departure by selecting one or more reservations, applying standard charges to the folio if not already posted, taking final payment at the cash register, and marking them checked out.
From the sidebar: Cashiering â†’ Quick Checkout. You must complete Cash Register Login first if prompted.

Select one or more reservations (e.g. by room or name) Apply standard charges (e.g. room, tax) if not already posted Take final payment and mark the reservation(s) as checked out Exact steps depend on your property's setup.

Transaction â€” Full folio access if you need to post or adjust before checkout. Night Audit â€” Run after all checkouts and cashier activity; Reports for billing and night audit reports. Cashier Shift â€” Reconcile after quick checkouts. Front Desk â€” In-House and Checked-Out lists.

The Front Desk area covers room plan, in-house guests, and checked-out guests. Use it for daily front-office tasks, room assignment, and quick access to folio and checkout. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections. In the app, Front Desk is a menu with three sub-screens: Screen Purpose Room Plan View rooms and occupancy by date; assign rooms, check in, start new reservations. In-House List of guests currently checked in; open reservation or folio, check out, change room. Checked-Out List of departed guests; review check-outs, reopen folio if allowed.
From the sidebar, open Front Desk, then choose Room Plan, In-House, or Checked-Out. What you see depends on user permissions.

Why don't I see the Room Plan or In-House list? Your user may not have front-desk or reservation permission. Ask your administrator to grant access to Front Desk (room plan, in-house, checked-out). What is the difference between In-House and Checked-Out? In-House shows guests currently staying (checked in, not yet departed). Checked-Out shows guests who have already departed, usually for a selected date or range. For more FAQs and troubleshooting, see Room Plan, In-House, or Checked-Out. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Cashiering â€” Open folio and post charges or payments from reservation or front-desk screens; Transaction for full folio access. Night Audit â€” Run after front-desk and cashier activity; Reports for night audit and billing reports. Reservations â€” Room plan and in-house/checked-out are based on reservation data and status. Housekeeping â€” Room status (clean/dirty, etc.) can be shown or used when assigning rooms.
The Room Plan shows rooms and their status over a chosen date range. Use it to see availability and quickly assign or change rooms.
From the sidebar: Front Desk â†’ Room Plan.

Rooms grouped by floor, type, or layout For each room: status (e.g. available, occupied, out of order, maintenance), guest name, arrival/departure, housekeeping status Filters by date, room type, status, floor, etc.

Select a room â€” Click a room to see reservation details or actions. New reservation â€” Start a reservation for that room/date (opens reservation form). Check in â€” If the reservation is due and the room is ready, check the guest in from the room plan or reservation detail. Check out â€” Complete checkout from the room or from the reservation.

Problem Cause Solution Room plan shows wrong date The selected date or business date is not the one you expect. Change the date filter on the room plan. If your property uses a system (business) date, ensure night audit has been run up to the date you need. Cannot check in from room plan Reservation not due or not in a check-in-allowed status; room not ready. Ensure arrival is today (or within policy), status is confirmed, and in Housekeeping the room is Vacant Clean / Ready. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

In-House â€” Guests who appear after check-in. Checked-Out â€” Guests who have departed. Reservations â€” Create or edit bookings from the room plan. Housekeeping â€” Room readiness (e.g. Vacant Clean) before check-in.

The Maintenance tab is used to log maintenance requests or room maintenance records, associate them with room and type/reason (from configuration), and track status (open, in progress, done). Rooms in maintenance may appear as a separate status on room status and room plan.
Room Status â€” Maintenance may affect room status. Configuration overview â€” Room Maintenance Reason, Maintenance Type under HouseKeeping & Maintenance.
User Activity Logs record actions performed by users in the PMS (e.g. login, reservation change, payment, configuration change). Use them for auditing and troubleshooting.
From the sidebar: Operations â†’ General â†’ User Activity Logs. Visibility depends on user permissions (e.g. view_useractivitylog).

The log list typically shows: Date / time â€” When the action occurred User â€” Who performed it Action â€” Type of action (e.g. Login, Create Reservation, Post Payment, Edit Room) Module or screen â€” Where it was done Details â€” Object ID, old/new values, or summary (depending on configuration) Use filters (date range, user, action, module) to narrow results.

Click a row (or use View) to open the full log entry. You may see: Request method and endpoint (for API actions) Request/response summary or body (if logged) Changed fields (before/after) for updates IP address or session (if captured)
If available, export logs to CSV or Excel for auditing or compliance.

Auditing â€” Who did what and when Troubleshooting â€” Trace back a change (e.g. rate, reservation, payment) Security â€” Detect unusual or unauthorized activity Compliance â€” Retain evidence of user actions
What is logged (e.g. which modules, which fields) is usually controlled in the backend or user activity log configuration. Contact your administrator to change what is captured.

Out of Order lists and manages rooms taken out of sale. Add a room and optional dates/reason; edit or end the record when the room is sellable again. Out-of-order rooms are excluded from availability and may be visible on the room plan and dashboard.
Room Status â€” Out of Order is one of the room statuses. Configuration overview â€” Out of Order/Service Reason under HouseKeeping & Maintenance.
In Lost & Found you can register found items, link to a lost & found reason if configured, search by guest/room/date/item, and record when the item is returned or disposed of.
Room, date, description, location (from setup) Lost & found reason if configured Notifications may alert staff when new lost & found entries are added.
Configuration overview â€” Lost & Found Reason under HouseKeeping & Maintenance.

The Housekeeping module is used to track room status, assign tasks, manage lost & found, maintenance, and out-of-order rooms. In the app, the main screen is Housekeeping Management, with tabs for each area. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections. Tab / Screen Purpose Room Status Status of each room (Vacant Clean/Dirty, Occupied Clean/Dirty, Pick-up, Inspected, Out of Order, Out of Service). Tasks Housekeeping tasks and assignments; assign to attendants or sections. Lost & Found Register and manage lost and found items. Maintenance Maintenance requests or room maintenance status. Out of Order Rooms marked out of order; add/edit/end.
From the sidebar, click Housekeeping. The main screen is Housekeeping Management. What you see depends on user permissions.

The PMS can show notifications for new lost & found, room status changes, maintenance, tasks, and out of order. Use the notification bell (if available) to open and act on them. Some notifications deep-link to the relevant housekeeping tab.

Why don't I see the Housekeeping menu? Your user may not have housekeeping permission (room status, tasks, lost & found, maintenance, out-of-order). Ask your administrator to grant access. What does Vacant Clean vs Vacant Dirty mean? Vacant Clean means the room is ready to sell (cleaned, no guest). Vacant Dirty means the room is empty but needs cleaning before it can be sold or assigned. Where do I add a lost & found item? Go to Housekeeping â†’ Lost & Found tab. Use Add or Register to enter room, date, description, and location. Link to a lost & found reason if configured. How do I mark a room Out of Order? Go to Housekeeping â†’ Out of Order tab. Add the room and optional dates/reason. The room is excluded from availability until you end or clear the out-of-order record. Can I assign a housekeeping task to a specific attendant? Yes, if your property uses housekeeping tasks and attendances. In the Tasks tab, create or open a task, assign it to an attendant or section, and set status (in progress, done). Task types are defined in Configuration â†’ HouseKeeping & Maintenance.

Problem Cause Solution Room status not updating Page not refreshed; or you lack permission to change that room. Refresh the page. Confirm you have permission to change room status for that room or section. Lost & found or maintenance not saving Required fields (e.g. reason, location) missing; or related setup not configured. Fill all required fields. Ensure lost & found reasons, locations, or maintenance types exist in Configuration â†’ HouseKeeping & Maintenance. Cannot change room to Vacant Clean Room may be occupied or in a status that blocks the change. Ensure the guest has checked out and the room is vacant. Use the correct status transition per your property's workflow. Out-of-order room still shows as available Out-of-order record ended or not applied for the dates you are viewing. Check Out of Order list; add or edit the record so it covers the dates and property you need. Tasks tab empty or missing Housekeeping tasks or attendances not configured; or you lack task permission. Ask your administrator to set up housekeeping tasks and attendances in Configuration. Confirm your role can view/assign tasks. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Reservations â€” Room assignment and status affect availability and check-in. Front Desk â€” Room plan and check-in use housekeeping status (e.g. Vacant Clean) when assigning rooms. Configuration overview â€” HouseKeeping & Maintenance setup (sections, tasks, attendances, lost & found reasons, out-of-order rules).

Night Audit is the end-of-day process that closes the business date, posts room revenue, and produces reports. It is typically run once per property per day. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections. Suggested screenshot Add a screenshot of the Night Audit screen (audit runs list or Run night audit dialog) here. Save as static/img/docs/night-audit.png. See Screenshot guide.
From the sidebar, click Night Audit. You see Audit Runs and related tabs (e.g. Overview, Reservations, Revenue, Payments, Room Status, Exceptions, Reports, Guest Ledger).
An audit run is one execution of the night audit for a given business date.

Open Night Audit and choose Run Night Audit (or similar). Confirm the business date to be closed (often today or the date you are closing). Start the run. The system will: Validate data (e.g. open balances, exceptions) Post room charges for in-house stays for that date Roll system date to the next business day (if configured) Generate or update audit reports Resolve any exceptions reported before or after the run, if required by your procedures.

Post Room Charge posts room revenue to guest folios for the relevant night. It uses: In-house reservations for the audit date Rate and room assignment from the reservation You can run it as part of the full audit or, in some setups, from a separate Post Room Charge screen (e.g. from Night Audit or Cashiering).
Audit Runs table lists previous runs with date, status, and user. Open a run to see its summary, reservations, revenue, payments, room status, exceptions, reports, and guest ledger for that date.
High-level totals: room revenue, other revenue, payments, occupancy, etc., for the audit date.
Reservations that were in-house or otherwise included in that audit run (arrivals, departures, stayovers).
Revenue breakdown by type (e.g. room, tax, other). Used to verify totals.
Payments posted on that date or linked to the audit. Helps reconcile front office and cashier.
Snapshot of room status (e.g. occupied, vacant, out of order) at audit time.

Items that need attention, for example: Folios with balance (guest balance not zero) High balance or credit limits Missing or invalid data Rate or posting issues Resolve exceptions as per your policy; some systems allow marking an exception as â€œresolvedâ€ with a note.
Lists night audit reports generated for that run (e.g. daily summary, revenue, occupancy). Open or export as configured.
Guest ledger view for the audit date: charges and payments per reservation/guest.

Night audit usually advances the system (business) date to the next day. That date is used as â€œtodayâ€ for: New reservations and searches Rate and availability Reporting The Dashboard and System Date widget show the current business date when your property uses it.

Run night audit once per day after all front office and cashier activity for that date is done. Reconcile cashier shifts and folios before running. Review exceptions and fix critical items before closing the date. Back up or export audit reports if required for accounting or compliance.

Why don't I see the Night Audit menu? Your user may not have night audit permission. Ask your administrator to grant access so you can run night audit and view runs and reports. When should I run night audit? Run it once per day, after all front-office and cashier activity for that business date is done. Reconcile cashier shifts and fix critical exceptions before running. What happens to the system date when I run night audit? Night audit usually advances the system (business) date to the next day. That date becomes â€œtodayâ€ for new reservations, rates, and reporting. The Dashboard shows the current business date when your property uses it. Can I run night audit more than once for the same date? Typically no. One audit run per property per business date is the norm. Running again may overwrite or conflict. If you must re-run, follow your propertyâ€™s procedure and any vendor guidance. Where do I see exceptions before or after the run? Open Night Audit and use the Exceptions tab (or the exceptions section of the run). Resolve critical items (e.g. open balances, invalid data) before closing the date, and document as per your policy.

Problem Cause Solution Night audit fails or shows exceptions Open balances, invalid data, or missing room charges; cashier shifts not closed if required. Resolve listed exceptions (post missing room charges, correct rates, close shifts). Fix critical items before running again. System date did not advance Run may have been in report-only or dry-run mode; or an error stopped the run. Check the audit run status and logs. Ensure you ran the full night audit (not report-only). Re-run if allowed by your procedure. Room charges not posted Run failed before posting; or in-house reservations had no rate/room. Fix exceptions and run again, or use Post Room Charge from Night Audit or Cashiering for the relevant date. Ensure in-house reservations have rate and room. Cannot open a past audit run Permission or date range may restrict which runs you see. Confirm you have permission to view night audit runs. If filtered by date, adjust the filter to include that run. Reports empty or wrong totals Wrong audit run or business date selected; or data not yet generated. Pick the correct audit run or business date for the report. Ensure the run completed successfully before opening reports. For login, permissions, wrong property, and other general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Cashiering â€” Close cash register shifts and reconcile folios before night audit; Post Room Charge from Transaction if needed. Reports â€” Night Audit reports (daily summary, revenue, guest ledger, folio data) and Billing for revenue and balances. Reservations / Front Desk â€” In-house reservations and room/rate data feed room charges and audit reports. Configuration overview â€” System date, transaction codes, and audit settings under System Settings.
The Tasks tab is used to create housekeeping tasks, assign them to attendants or sections, and mark them done or in progress.

Create housekeeping tasks (e.g. clean room, deep clean, VIP setup) Assign tasks to attendants or sections Mark tasks done or in progress Tasks are often linked to rooms and to housekeeping setup tasks defined in Configuration â†’ HouseKeeping & Maintenance â†’ HK Task.
Room Status â€” Room readiness affects task assignment. Configuration overview â€” HK Task, HK Sections, HK Attendants under HouseKeeping & Maintenance.
The Room Status tab shows current status of all rooms. Use it to see which rooms are ready, need cleaning, or are out of order.

Vacant Clean â€” Ready to sell Vacant Dirty â€” Needs cleaning Occupied Clean â€” Guest in room, cleaned Occupied Dirty â€” Guest in room, needs cleaning Pick-up â€” Service requested or pick-up needed Inspected â€” Supervised check done Out of Order â€” Not sellable (e.g. repair) Out of Service â€” Withdrawn from inventory
Locate the room in the list or plan. Change its status (e.g. from Vacant Dirty to Vacant Clean after cleaning). Save. The dashboard and front desk room plan can reflect this.
Tasks â€” Assign cleaning or other tasks. Out of Order â€” Take rooms out of sale. Front Desk â€” Room plan uses housekeeping status when assigning rooms.
Company Profile stores data for companies used as guests, payers, or group organisers in reservations.
From the sidebar: Profile â†’ Company Profile.

The list shows companies with typical columns: Company name Code (if used) Contact (phone, email) Address Last stay or last activity (if available) Use search and filters (e.g. name, code) to find profiles.

Click Add or New Company Profile. Fill in at least the required fields, for example: Company name Code (if your property uses it) Contact â€” Phone, email, contact person Address â€” Country, city, state, postal code (from setup where applicable) Tax ID or registration number if used Payment terms or credit limit if used for billing Save. The profile can then be used in reservations and billing.
Open the profile from the list (click row or name). Change any allowed fields. Save. Changes apply to future reservations and billing; existing data may not change automatically.

When creating or editing a reservation: Guest â€” Use the company as the main guest (e.g. corporate stay). Payer â€” Route all or part of the bill to the company (billing/routing). Group â€” Use the company as the group organiser or master bill payer. In Cashiering, use routing or split folio to send charges to the company profile.
Countries, states, cities, and other address/location codes are defined under Configuration â†’ Profile. Set those up first so company profiles use consistent values.

Profiles store guest and payer information used in reservations and billing. The PMS supports three profile types: Individual Profile â€” Persons (guests, contacts) Company Profile â€” Companies (corporate, groups, payers) Travel Agent Profile â€” Travel agents and agencies Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections.
From the sidebar, click Profile, then choose: Individual Profile Company Profile Travel Agent Profile Visibility depends on your user permissions.

Reservations â€” Assign a profile as guest or payer. Billing â€” Route charges to a company or travel agent profile; use individual as guest. Search â€” Find existing profiles by name, code, or contact before creating duplicates.

Many fields (titles, countries, languages, VIP levels, loyalty tiers, etc.) are defined in Configuration â†’ Profile (or equivalent). Create and maintain profiles after those codes are set for consistency.

Use case Profile type Guest (person staying) Individual Profile Payer (company paying the bill) Company Profile Payer (travel agent or agency) Travel Agent Profile Contact or secondary guest Individual Profile Billing routed to company Company Profile (assign as payer; use routing in reservation/folio) Billing routed to travel agent Travel Agent Profile (assign as payer; use routing) You can combine them: e.g. Individual as guest, Company as payer; or Individual as guest, Travel Agent as payer.

Why don't I see the Profile menu or one of the profile types? Your user may not have permission for that profile type (individual, company, or travel agent). Ask your administrator to grant access to view/add/edit the profile type you need. Do I create a new profile for every guest? No. Search first by name, email, or phone. Use an existing profile if it matches to avoid duplicates. Create a new one only when no suitable profile exists. What is the difference between Individual, Company, and Travel Agent? Individual = persons (guests, contacts). Company = companies (corporate, groups) used as payers. Travel Agent = travel agents/agencies used as payers or for commission. Use the type that matches how you bill and report. Can I use a company as the guest? Typically the guest is an Individual (the person staying). The payer can be a Company or Travel Agent. Some setups allow a company name on the reservation while the main guest is still an individual; follow your property's practice. Where do I set titles, countries, VIP levels? These are in Configuration â†’ Profile Setup (or equivalent). Create those codes first so when you add or edit a profile you can select from the list. See Configuration overview.

Problem Cause Solution Profile not found in reservation search Wrong profile type, spelling, or filters. Search in the correct type (individual/company/travel agent). Try partial name or contact. Clear filters if applied. Cannot save profile â€” field invalid Required field missing or value not in setup (e.g. country, title). Fill required fields. Use values from Configuration â†’ Profile Setup (countries, titles, etc.). Duplicate profiles Same guest/company created more than once. Search before creating. Merge or deactivate duplicates per your property's policy; use one profile for future reservations. Company or travel agent not in payer list You are in Individual Profile or the payer list filters by type. In the reservation or folio, choose the payer type (company / travel agent) and search. Ensure the profile exists in Company or Travel Agent Profile. For login, permissions, wrong property, and other general issues, see Troubleshooting.
Individual Profile â€” Persons and guests Company Profile â€” Companies and corporate Travel Agent Profile â€” Travel agents

Reservations â€” Assign profiles as guest or payer. Cashiering â€” Route charges to company or travel agent; view folio by guest. Configuration overview â€” Profile setup (titles, countries, VIP levels, etc.) under Configuration.
Individual Profile stores data for persons used as guests or contacts in reservations.
From the sidebar: Profile â†’ Individual Profile.

The list shows individuals with typical columns: Name Title Contact (phone, email) VIP level (if used) Nationality, country Last stay or last activity (if available) Use search and filters (e.g. name, VIP, nationality) to find profiles.

Click Add or New Individual Profile. Fill in at least the required fields, for example: Name Title (from setup) Contact â€” Phone, email Address â€” Country, city, state, postal code (from setup where applicable) Nationality (from setup) VIP level (from setup) ID / NRC if used Preferences, loyalty tier, language if available Save. The profile can then be used in reservations.

Open the profile from the list (click row or name). Change any allowed fields. Save. Changes apply to future reservations; existing reservations may keep the data they had at creation, depending on configuration.

When creating or editing a reservation: Guest â€” Select an individual profile as the main guest. Contact â€” Optionally link another individual as contact or secondary guest. Profiles are linked to the reservation; updates to the profile do not always change past reservations.

Titles, countries, states, cities, nationalities, VIP levels, languages, preferences, and loyalty tiers are defined under Configuration â†’ Profile (or equivalent). Create those codes first so individual profiles use consistent values.
Travel Agent Profile stores data for travel agents and agencies used in reservations and commission or billing routing.
From the sidebar: Profile â†’ Travel Agent Profile.

The list shows travel agents with typical columns: Agent or agency name Code (if used) Contact (phone, email) Commission or rate (if used) Last stay or last activity (if available) Use search and filters (e.g. name, code) to find profiles.

Click Add or New Travel Agent Profile. Fill in at least the required fields, for example: Agent / agency name Code (if your property uses it) Contact â€” Phone, email Address â€” Country, city, etc. (from setup where applicable) Commission or rate if used IATA or agency number if used Save. The profile can then be used in reservations.
Open the profile from the list (click row or name). Change any allowed fields. Save. Changes apply to future reservations; existing reservations may keep the data they had at creation.

When creating or editing a reservation: Source â€” Choose the travel agent as source (from reservation source setup). Payer / routing â€” Route all or part of the bill to the travel agent (e.g. agent pays room, guest pays incidentals). Commission â€” If the system supports it, commission may be calculated from the agent's profile or rate. In Cashiering, use routing or split folio to send charges to the travel agent profile.

Source codes and billing/routing rules are defined under Configuration (e.g. reservation setup, cashiering). Set those up so travel agent profiles are linked correctly to sources and revenue/commission logic.

Night audit reports include daily summary, revenue summary, room revenue, exceptions, and guest ledger (charges and payments per folio) for the audit date. Often selected by audit run or business date.

Night Audit â€” Run night audit, view runs and summaries. Cashiering â€” Reconcile cash register and folio before night audit; Post Room Charge from Transaction. Reports Overview â€” How to run and export reports. Billing for folio and revenue detail.

Billing and revenue reports: revenue by transaction code or category, payments by type, outstanding balances, folio summary. Use after night audit or cashiering to verify totals. Filters often include date range and transaction or payment type.

Cashiering â€” Transaction, Cashier Shift, folio and cash register data. Night Audit â€” Post room charges, close date; Night Audit reports for daily summary and guest ledger. Reports Overview â€” How to run and export reports.

Operations covers the day-to-day use of the PMS: reservations, front desk, cashiering (folio, cash register), housekeeping, night audit, and reports. Use this section to find the right screen and workflow for each task. Having a problem? Each module has its own Common FAQs and Troubleshooting sections. See the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific help for Reservations, Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, Night Audit, Dashboard, Configuration, and Profiles. Structure: Reservations has an overview and sub-views (All Reservations, Arrivals, Departures, Waitlist, Cancellations). Profiles has an overview and one doc per profile type. Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, and Reports each have an overview and one doc per sub-screen (e.g. Front Desk â†’ Room Plan, In-House, Checked-Out). Night Audit is a single doc; Workflows covers end-to-end flows.

Area What itâ€™s for Workflows End-to-end flows: check-in (reservation â†’ room ready â†’ check in â†’ folio) and end-of-day (close cashier â†’ run night audit â†’ review reports). Reservations Create, edit, and manage bookings; List, Arrivals, Departures, Waitlist, Cancellations. Front Desk Room plan (rooms and occupancy by date), In-house (current guests), Checked-out (departed guests). Cashiering Transaction (folio, charges, payments), Cashier shift, Quick checkout. Requires cash register login. Housekeeping Room status, tasks, lost & found, maintenance, out-of-order. Night Audit Run night audit, post room charges, view runs, summaries, exceptions, reports, guest ledger. Reports Reservation, frontdesk, billing, housekeeping, and night audit reports; filters and export.

By task â€” Use Workflows for full procedures (check-in, end-of-day). By module â€” Use the links above for the screen you need (reservations, room plan, folio, housekeeping, night audit, reports). From the app â€” The sidebar Reservation, Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, Night Audit, and Report items map to these docs.
What you see in the app depends on your user permissions. If a menu item is missing, your account may not have access. See Roles and permissions.

Cashiering â€” Folio, cash register login, Transaction, Cashier Shift, Quick Checkout. Night Audit â€” Close business date, post room charges, audit reports and guest ledger. Reports â€” Night audit, billing (folio summary), reservation, frontdesk, housekeeping reports. Dashboard â€” Overview and quick actions into reservations, room plan, housekeeping. Configuration â€” Setup for rooms, rates, cashiering, housekeeping, etc. Profiles â€” Individual, company, travel agent profiles used in reservations and billing.
Front-desk and room-related reports: room occupancy, room status summary, room plan or availability. Filters often include date and room type.
Front Desk â€” Room plan, in-house, checked-out. Reports Overview â€” How to run and export reports.

The Report module provides predefined reports for reservations, front desk, billing (including folio summary), housekeeping, and night audit. Use it to run folio, cash register, and night audit reports from one place. In the app, Report is a menu with categories you can choose. Having a problem? See the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting for Reservations, Front Desk, Cashiering, Housekeeping, Night Audit, Dashboard, Configuration, and Profiles. Category Purpose Reservation Arrivals/departures, in-house, pickup, cancellations, revenue or occupancy by segment/source/rate. Frontdesk Room occupancy, room status summary, room plan or availability. Billing Revenue by transaction code or category, payments by type, outstanding balances, folio summary. Housekeeping Room status, task completion, lost & found log, maintenance log, out-of-order list. Night Audit Daily summary, revenue summary, room revenue, exceptions, guest ledger for the audit date.

From the sidebar, click Report. Choose a category (Reservation, Frontdesk, Billing, Housekeeping, Night Audit) from the menu or from a dropdown/tabs on the report page. What you see depends on user permissions.

Select category â€” Reservation, Frontdesk, Billing, Housekeeping, or Night Audit. Set filters â€” Date range, property, department, status, etc. Run / Apply â€” Generate the report. View â€” Results appear in a table or summary. Export â€” If available, export to Excel, PDF, or CSV for accounting or management.

Night Audit â€” Run night audit; reports from each run and Night Audit reports (daily summary, guest ledger, folio data). Cashiering â€” Transaction, Cashier Shift, folio and cash register data; Billing reports for revenue and outstanding balances. Reservations â€” For reservation and occupancy data. Housekeeping â€” For room status and tasks.

Reservation-related reports: arrivals/departures by date, in-house list, reservation pickup (by date, source, type), cancellations, revenue or occupancy by segment, source, or rate. Use filters (date range, status, room type, source, etc.) to narrow results.
Reservations â€” Source of reservation data. Reports Overview â€” How to run and export reports.
The reservation list (or â€œAll Reservationsâ€) shows all bookings. Use it to search, filter, create, edit, and manage reservations.
From the sidebar: Reservation (main list). You may also reach it from Dashboard â†’ View reservations or similar.

Typical columns: Confirmation/reference Guest name Room type / room number Arrival and departure dates Status (e.g. reserved, confirmed, checked-in, checked-out, cancelled) Nights Rate / amount Use filters and search (by name, confirmation, dates, etc.) to find specific reservations.

Click New Reservation (or use the quick action from the Dashboard). Fill in the main details: Guest â€” Select or create an individual, company, or travel agent profile. Dates â€” Arrival and departure. Room type â€” Desired room type; the system may suggest or assign a specific room. Rate â€” Rate code, rate amount, or package. Adults / Children â€” Occupancy. Special requests, market, source, reservation type, etc., if available. Save. A confirmation number is generated. You can also start from Front Desk â†’ Room Plan by selecting a room and choosing â€œNew reservationâ€ for that room/date.

Open the reservation from the list (click the row or confirmation number). Change any allowed fields (dates, room, rate, guest, comments, etc.). Save. Billing and room assignment may update automatically depending on configuration.

From the reservation detail screen you can: View and edit guest, stay, room, and rate information See billing/folio and add charges or payments (or go to Cashiering) Add comments or internal notes View alerts and messages Manage routing (e.g. split billing or route to different profiles) Check in or Check out when the reservation is in the correct status
Arrivals â€” Guests arriving on a date Departures â€” Guests departing on a date Waitlist â€” When no room or rate is available Cancellations â€” Cancelled reservations
The Arrivals view (or filter) shows guests arriving on a selected date. Use it to see who is due to check in and prepare rooms and check-in.
From the sidebar: Reservation, then choose Arrivals or set the arrival date filter. The exact label may be â€œArrivalsâ€, â€œArrivals Todayâ€, or a date filter depending on the app.

Reservations with arrival date on the selected date, typically with: Guest name Room type / room number Arrival and departure dates Status (e.g. confirmed, checked in) Rate / amount Use this view to confirm room readiness, assign rooms, and perform check-in.
All Reservations â€” Full list and filters Departures â€” Guests leaving on a date Front Desk â†’ Room Plan â€” Assign room and check in Housekeeping â€” Room status before check-in
Housekeeping reports: room status (vacant clean/dirty, occupied, etc.), task completion, lost & found log, maintenance log, out-of-order list. Filters may include date, floor, section, or status.
Housekeeping â€” Room status, tasks, lost & found, maintenance, out-of-order. Reports Overview â€” How to run and export reports.

The Cancellations view lists cancelled reservations. When you cancel a reservation, you often must choose a cancellation reason (from configuration). Cancellation may trigger policies (e.g. fees, release of inventory) depending on setup.
From the sidebar: Reservation, then the Cancellations tab or link (if your property uses it).

List and filter cancelled reservations Cancellation date, reason, and related details (depending on the app) When cancelling a reservation (from the reservation detail or list), select a cancellation reason from the list. Add or manage reasons in Configuration â†’ Reservation â†’ Cancellation Reason.
All Reservations â€” Cancel from the reservation detail or list Reservations Overview â€” Statuses and troubleshooting Configuration overview â€” Cancellation reasons under Reservation setup
The Waitlist is used when no suitable room or rate is available. Store the request and convert it to a full reservation when space opens.
From the sidebar: Reservation, then the Waitlist tab or link (if your property uses waitlist).

Add a waitlist request â€” Requested dates, room type, guest, and contact details. Store requested dates, room type, guest, and contact details. When space opens, convert the waitlist entry into a full reservation. Use the waitlist to avoid losing demand when the house is full or rates are closed.
All Reservations â€” Create or edit reservations after converting from waitlist Reservations Overview â€” Statuses and workflow

This page describes two common end-to-end workflows: check-in (from reservation to in-house) and end-of-day cashier and night audit. Use them as reference when training staff or writing local procedures.
From a confirmed reservation to an in-house guest with a ready room and open folio.
Guest has a confirmed (or equivalent) reservation for todayâ€™s arrival. Reservation shows correct guest, room type (or room), dates, and rate. See Reservations to create or edit reservations.
In Housekeeping, ensure the assigned (or to-be-assigned) room is Vacant Clean or Ready. If the room is dirty or under maintenance, change status or assign another room. See Housekeeping.

In Reservation or Front Desk â†’ Room plan, assign a specific room number if the reservation only had a room type. Or use Room plan to see which room is allocated and that it is available. See Front Desk.

Open the reservation (from Reservation list or Front Desk â†’ Room plan or In-house). Use Check in (or equivalent). The reservation status becomes In-house (or Checked in). The guest is now in-house and room charges can post to the folio.

Go to Cashiering â†’ Transaction (after cash register login if required). Select the reservation. The folio is used for all charges and payments during the stay. Post room and tax as per your property (e.g. at check-in or via night audit). Add any deposit or advance payment if required. See Cashiering.
Reservation (confirmed) â†’ Room ready (Housekeeping) â†’ Assign room â†’ Check in â†’ Folio open for charges/payments
Closing the business day: cashier reconciliation, then night audit.
documents.s: End-of-Day Cashier and Night Audit Flow

documents.t: Finish posting all charges and payments for the day. In Cashiering â†’ Cashier shift, close the shift (or equivalent): Declare expected vs actual cash (and other payment types if required). Resolve any variance per your propertyâ€™s policy. Ensure all folios that should be settled for that day are handled. See Cashiering.

In Night Audit, open the last run or prepare a new run. Review exceptions (e.g. open balances, high balance, missing data). Resolve critical exceptions before running the final audit (e.g. post missing room charges, correct rates, or document variances). See Night Audit.

In Night Audit, start Run night audit (or equivalent). Confirm the business date to close (usually today). Start the run. The system will: Post room charges for all in-house guests for that night. Advance the system (business) date to the next day (if configured). Generate audit reports and update statistics. See Night Audit.
Open the completed audit run. Check Overview, Revenue, Payments, Room status, and Exceptions. Use Reports or Guest ledger for that date if you need to file or reconcile with accounting. See Reports.
Per your propertyâ€™s policy, back up the database or export key reports (e.g. night audit summary, revenue, guest ledger) for the closed date.
All charges/payments done â†’ Close cashier shift â†’ Fix critical exceptions â†’ Run night audit â†’ Review reports / backup

Reservations â€” Creating and managing reservations Front Desk â€” Room plan, in-house, checked-out Cashiering â€” Transactions, shift, quick checkout Housekeeping â€” Room status and tasks Night Audit â€” Running audit and reviewing runs Reports â€” Running and exporting reports

The Reservation module is used to create, view, edit, and manage guest reservations. It is linked to profiles (individual, company, travel agent), rooms, rates, and billing. Having a problem? This page has Common FAQs and Troubleshooting below. For issues in other modules, see the main Troubleshooting page â€” it links to module-specific FAQs and troubleshooting sections. In the app, Reservation has views or tabs such as: View / Tab Purpose All Reservations Full reservation list; search, filters, create, edit, check in/out. Arrivals Guests arriving on a selected date. Departures Guests departing on a selected date. Waitlist Requests when no suitable room or rate is available; convert to reservation when space opens. Cancellations List and filter cancelled reservations; cancellation reasons.
From the sidebar, click Reservation. You see the reservation list and optionally tabs or links for Waitlist and Cancellations. What you see depends on configuration and user permissions.

Reservations move through statuses such as: Reserved / Confirmed â€” Booking is held. Checked In â€” Guest is in-house; charges post to folio. Checked Out â€” Stay is complete; balance should be settled. Cancelled â€” Booking is no longer active. Check-in and check-out are often done from Front Desk (In-House, Room Plan, Checked-Out) or from the reservation detail actions.

Why don't I see the Reservation menu? Your user may not have reservation permission. Ask your administrator to grant access or add you to a group that can view reservations. How do I check in a guest from the reservation? Open the reservation, ensure the room is ready in Housekeeping (e.g. Vacant Clean) and the status allows check-in, then use Check in (or equivalent). The guest will appear in Front Desk â†’ In-House. Where is the waitlist? If your property uses waitlist, a Waitlist tab or link appears on the Reservation screen. Use it when no suitable room or rate is available; you can convert an entry to a full reservation when space opens. Can I cancel and recreate a reservation instead of editing dates? You can, but you may lose history and create a new confirmation number. Prefer editing the reservation when only dates or room change; use cancellation when the stay is truly cancelled.

Problem Cause Solution Room type not available Dates fully booked, room out of order, or rate/availability not set for that date. Check dates and room status (e.g. out of order). Confirm rate/availability in Configuration for that room type and date. Cannot check in Reservation not in a check-in-allowed status, or room not ready. Ensure status is confirmed (or equivalent). In Housekeeping, set the room to Vacant Clean / Ready before check-in. Cannot change room Target room occupied or not sellable; missing room-move permission or reason. Verify target room is available and sellable. Check permissions and that a room-move reason exists in configuration. Guest or payer not in list Profile may not exist or you are searching the wrong type (individual vs company). Search in the correct profile type, or create a new profile from the reservation form. Cancellation reason required Configuration requires a reason when cancelling. Select a cancellation reason from the list provided; add new reasons in Configuration if needed. For general issues, see Troubleshooting.

Profiles â€” Individual, company, and travel agent profiles used as guests or payers. Front Desk â€” Room plan, in-house list, checked-out list. Cashiering â€” Post charges, take payments, view folios. Configuration overview â€” Reservation types, sources, room types, rates, cancellation reasons, etc.
The Departures view (or filter) shows guests departing on a selected date. Use it to see who is due to check out and prepare folios and checkout.
From the sidebar: Reservation, then choose Departures or set the departure date filter. The exact label may be â€œDeparturesâ€, â€œDepartures Todayâ€, or a date filter depending on the app.

Reservations with departure date on the selected date, typically with: Guest name Room number Arrival and departure dates Status (e.g. checked in, checked out) Folio/balance (or link to billing) Use this view to settle folios, perform check-out, and confirm rooms for housekeeping.
All Reservations â€” Full list and filters Arrivals â€” Guests arriving on a date Front Desk â†’ Checked-Out â€” Departed guests Cashiering â€” Settle folio before checkout

Follow these steps in order to see the main flow of the PMS: login â†’ dashboard â†’ one reservation â†’ one check-in â†’ one folio. Use this path when you are new to the system or training staff. More detail Each step links to the full doc. For login, navigation, and â€œBy roleâ€, see Introduction. For end-to-end flows, see Workflows.
Open the PMS in your browser. Enter your username and password. Click Login. You are taken to the Dashboard. See Introduction â†’ Logging in for details and screenshots.

After login you land on the Dashboard. From here you can: See occupancy, revenue, and housekeeping summary Use quick links into reservations, room plan, and other modules Spend a moment looking at the widgets and quick actions. See Dashboard for full detail.

Go to Reservation in the sidebar. Either create a new reservation (guest, dates, room type/room, rate) or find an existing reservation for todayâ€™s arrival. Make sure it is Confirmed (or equivalent) and has a room (or room type) and rate. See Reservations and Reservation list for creating and editing reservations.

Ensure the room is ready: in Housekeeping, the room should be Vacant Clean (or Ready). Change status if needed. Open the reservation (from Reservation or Front Desk â†’ Room plan or In-House). Use Check in. The reservation becomes In-house (or Checked in). The guest is now in-house; charges can post to their folio. See Front Desk, Room plan, and Workflows â†’ Check-in for the full check-in flow.

For Cashiering, log in to a cash register first if prompted (Cash Register Login). Go to Cashiering â†’ Transaction. Select the reservation you just checked in. Its guest folio opens. Optionally add a charge (e.g. room, tax) or post a payment (e.g. deposit). Save. You have now used: login â†’ dashboard â†’ reservation â†’ check-in â†’ folio in one short path. See Cashiering and Transaction (Guest Folio) for daily cashier and folio work.

Guidelines for keeping the Hotelium PMS manual buildable, link-valid, and consistent.

Use absolute paths for doc-to-doc links so they work from any page and from the built site: Do: [Introduction](/docs/intro), [Reservations](/docs/operations/reservations/overview) Avoid: [Introduction](../intro), [Reservations](./reservations) (relative paths) Internal anchors are fine: [Section](#section-name).

Build = link check: npm run build fails if any doc link is broken (onBrokenLinks: 'throw' in docusaurus.config.js). CI: If GitHub Actions is used, the Docs workflow runs on push/PR to main (or master) and runs npm ci and npm run build. Fix broken links before merging. Local: Run npm run build (or npm run validate) before pushing to catch broken links early.

When updating procedures, aim to add or refresh these screenshots. See Screenshot guide for filenames and where to use them. Priority Screenshot Doc(s) Filename Must Login screen Intro login.png Must Dashboard Dashboard dashboard.png Must Reservation list or new-reservation form Reservations reservation-list.png or reservation-form.png Must Transaction / folio Cashiering folio.png Must Night audit (runs or run dialog) Night Audit night-audit.png Nice Main sidebar Intro sidebar.png Nice Room plan Front Desk room-plan.png Nice Housekeeping management Housekeeping housekeeping.png Nice Notifications bell Notifications notifications-bell.png Nice Change password Profile and Security change-password.png Nice System Settings / config Configuration overview configuration.png Save images under static/img/docs/ and reference as /img/docs/<filename>.png.

If you need to ship multiple manual versions (e.g. v1.0, v1.1), use Docusaurus versioning: Add a version, e.g. docusaurus docs:version 1.0. Docs are versioned under /docs/1.0/...; current is /docs/.... Document your release process (when to cut a version, how to update the dropdown).
Command Purpose npm ci Clean install (use in CI). npm run build Build site; fails on broken links. npm run validate Same as npm run build (alias for CI or pre-commit). npm run start Local dev server.

docs/ â€” Markdown source; sidebar is autogenerated from here. Use sidebar_position in frontmatter and _category_.json for order. static/ â€” Served at /. Put screenshots in static/img/docs/, scripts in static/js/. src/ â€” React components, CSS, theme overrides. docusaurus.config.js â€” Title, theme, navbar, footer, plugins (search, etc.). sidebars.js â€” Sidebar config (currently autogenerated from docs/).
Screenshot guide â€” Full list of recommended screenshots and how to add them.
